title.narrative: Promotion of Intercommunity Harmony in Myanmar

description.narrative: This project aims to improve intercommunity relations and understanding so as to help foster a more inclusive and peaceful Myanmar for all.

mailing-address.narrative: No. 3, Pyay Road, 6 Miles, Hlaing Township, Yangon, Myanmar

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Through media productions supported by this project, relevant stakeholders to the development of Rakhine State and other at risk regions of Myanmar feel as though their voice is being heard and that each community in turns hears and understand the voices.

1.Reflections on the meetings from the participants 2.Reactions/reflections of the audiences from different communities (Rakhine, Muslim, Myanmar and others) on the project’s media productions 3.Reactions/reflections of concerned Myanmar authorities

target.value: 1. More media productions targeting to reflect voices of at risk communities 2. Meeting participants feel more positive towards other participants from different communities 3. Media audiences from targeted communities understand voices of other communities.

actual.value: 1. While all production under this project concerned at least potentially at risk persons and/or communities (in a social, political and/or economic sense), at least some 60 stories dealt directly with at risk and/or marginalized populations. 2. A certain level of communication and corresponding relationship among different ethnic and religious youth and women was created via the workshops where the participants exchanged and shared their experiences, feelings and concerns for their communities. 3. The diversity of programming – giving voice to Rakhine, Bamar, Muslim and other minorities in Rakhine State indicates target audiences were exposed to the voices of competing communities.

title.narrative: Capacity building through Youth Camps and Women’s Camps.

Number of youth camps and women's comps, and the number of participants. 1. Organizing 1 Youth Camp and 1 Women Camp/year (2 each, total 4 camps in two years) 2. Targeted number of participants to be confirmed
Media productions targeting to reflect voices of at risk communities .

1. Number of news update/media production in Rakhine language and Bengali languages on Arakan Yoma websites 2. Number of TV story in Burmese language on issues covered under this project in the Women in Myanmar Society TV program aired by MRTV 3. Number of TV story in Burmese language on the issues covered under this project in the Her World TV program aired by Mizzima TV 4. Number of radio program (15 minutes) on the issues covered under this project on the Arakan Yoma website/Facebook and if possible on May Yu FM in Burmese, Rakhine and Bengali languages 5. Number of the print version of the Radio program (or) TV program to be published in a local media outlet in Rakhine State (in Burmese)

target.value: 1. Text/audio/video stories and photos on Arakan Yoma (with a minimum weekly update) both in Rakhine and Bengali languages 2. One weekly TV story (minimum) on issues covered under this project in Burmese language in the Women in Myanmar Society TV program 3. One weekly TV story (minimum) on the issues covered under this project in the Her World TV program aired by Mizzima TV in Burmese language 4. One weekly radio program (15 minutes) on the issues covered under this project on the Arakan Yoma website/Facebook and if possible on May Yu FM in Burmese, Rakhine and Bengali languages 5. The print version of the Radio program (or) TV program to be published weekly in a local media outlet in Rakhine State

actual.value: Media Production in Ethnic language in Northern Rakhine (22 programs.) Media Production in Rakhine Language (56 programs) 22 radio posts in Rakhine language on Arakan Yoma Facebook and Website. 56 text and photo posts in Burmese language on Arakan Yoma Facebook and Website. 22 radio posts in Burmese language on Arakan Yoma Facebook and Website.
